result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail

8:37 AM Defendant Joseph M Ammons in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Joseph M Ammons.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests one more status to put things together before he meets with ADA. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with Donley Carey. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

AMENDED 04/20/22: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE A GPS EXCEPTION TO ALLOW FOR GOING TO WORK, MUST VERIFY HOURS WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES.

AMENDED 7/11/2022 to remove GPS and house arrest
